content: join as above 5sts round 2 ch1 work 2hdc in each st around join 10sts round 3 ch1 work 2hdc in each st around join 20sts round 4 ch1 half_double_crochet into the back loop only of each st around join 20sts rnds 5 ch1 half_double_crochet into each st around join 20sts round 6 ch1 half_double_crochet into each of the first 7sts hdc2tog x 3 half_double_crochet into each of the remaining 7sts join 17sts round 7 ch1 single_crochet in each of the net 6sts slip_stitch loosely in each of the next 5sts single_crochet in each of the remaining 6sts join 17sts round 8 slip_stitch loosley in each of the next 4sts first st already has a slip_stitch from the join ch8 not too tightly skip 7sts slip_stitch loosely in each of the remaining 5sts fasten_off and hide loose ends nelly s bloomers bloomers are worked from the waist down in joined rounds at the end of each round join the last st to the first with a slip_stitch… ch24 join last chain to first with a slip_stitch being careful not to twist the chain round 1 ch1 not a st from now on half_double_crochet into each chain around join as above 24sts round 2 ch1 half_double_crochet into the back loop only of each st around join 24sts now is a good time to try on the waist band for fit you are likely to have to put one leg through at a time but that s normal you do need to make sure that the waistband fits snuggly though to prevent the pants from falling down if it s too big start the waist band again using a smaller hook as appropriate if it s too small use a bigger hook as appropriate round 3 ch1 half_double_crochet in each of the first 11sts 2hdc in next st half_double_crochet in each of the next 11sts 2hdc in last st join 26sts round 4 ch1 half_double_crochet in each of the first 12sts 2hdc in next st half_double_crochet in each of the next 12sts 2hdc in last st join 28sts round 5 ch1 half_double_crochet into each st around join 28sts round 6 ch1 single_crochet into each of the first 14sts skip 14sts and join first leg hole formed 14sts place a stitch marker into the first 15th unworked st and the last unworked st to help with the second pant leg later round 7 ch1 work a tw single_crochet see special stitches into each st around join 14sts fasten_off and hide loose ends for first pant leg second pant leg with the trousers held upside down and the back of the work facing you attach your yarn to the stitch next to the crotch into the stitch marked with a marker last unworked st making sure to leave a long yarn tail as there will be a small hole between the pant legs which will need sewing up after you have finished this leg round 1 ch1 single_crochet in same st rotate to work
